Company description: SAMSUNG SDI Europe GmbH is a prominent subsidiary of Samsung SDI, specializing in the development and manufacturing of advanced battery solutions and electronic materials. The company focuses on lithium-ion batteries for a variety of applications, including electric vehicles (EVs), energy storage systems (ESS), and consumer electronics. With a mission to contribute to a sustainable future through innovative technology, SAMSUNG SDI Europe aims to lead the transition to eco-friendly energy solutions while prioritizing safety, quality, and environmental responsibility. The company's vision is to become a global top-tier battery manufacturer by 2030, emphasizing its commitment to sustainability and compliance with ethical standards. SAMSUNG SDI Europe collaborates with a diverse range of clients, including major automotive manufacturers such as Jaguar Land Rover and Stellantis, as well as technology firms and energy providers. These partnerships enhance its technological capabilities and market reach, allowing the company to meet the growing demand for high-performance battery systems in the European market. The company actively engages in initiatives that promote responsible consumption and production, aligning its operations with global environmental standards and the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (UN SDGs). With a workforce dedicated to innovation and continuous improvement, SAMSUNG SDI Europe is committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050 and has joined the RE100 initiative to transition to 100% renewable energy. The company emphasizes a culture of safety and quality, aiming for zero high-consequence incidents by 2030 and integrating advanced technologies into its operations. Through its comprehensive sustainability management strategies, SAMSUNG SDI Europe strives to create a positive impact on the environment and society while delivering exceptional value to its customers. By fostering a circular economy and minimizing its ecological footprint, SAMSUNG SDI Europe is well-positioned to lead the battery industry in the rapidly evolving energy landscape.

Company description: Liander is a key player in the Dutch energy sector, specializing in the development and management of energy networks, including electricity and gas. As part of Alliander, the company is dedicated to building a sustainable energy grid for the future, focusing on innovative infrastructure projects that have a significant societal impact. Liander's mission is to ensure reliable and affordable energy access for millions of households and businesses across the Netherlands, while actively contributing to the energy transition. The company collaborates with a diverse range of clients, including municipalities, construction firms, and energy providers, to design and implement projects such as solar parks, residential towers, and highway expansions. With a strong emphasis on teamwork and professional development, Liander seeks motivated engineers and technical professionals to join its ranks in shaping the energy landscape of tomorrow.

Company description: The development, manufacture, project management and servicing of wind turbines in the onshore segment has been the core competence and passion of the Nordex Group and its more than 9,000 employees worldwide for over 35 years.  As one of the world's largest wind turbine manufacturers, the Nordex Group offers high-yield, cost-efficient wind turbines that enable long-term and economical power generation from wind energy in all geographical and climatic conditions. The focus is on turbines in the 3 to 6 MW+ class, and the Group’s comprehensive product portfolio offers individual solutions for both markets with limited space and regions with limited grid capacities. A global service network, with some 350 service points throughout 30 countries, delivers service quickly to keep our systems running smoothly. The Group covers the needs of all customer segments within the global wind market, from large energy suppliers to SMEs operating power plants. With more than 45 GW of installed capacity worldwide, Nordex Group systems deliver sustainable energy throughout more than 80 per cent of the world’s energy market (excluding China).  Nordex SE is listed on the TecDAX and MDAX of the Frankfurt Stock Exchange (ISIN: DE000A0D6554). The management holding company is headquartered in Rostock, while the executive board and administrative offices are based in Hamburg. At production facilities in Germany, Spain, Brazil, the US, and India, the Nordex Group produces its own nacelles, rotor blades and concrete towers. The Group also maintains offices and branches in more than 30 countries.

Company description: Luminus is a leading energy provider in Belgium, dedicated to delivering innovative and sustainable energy solutions tailored to the needs of its diverse clientele, which includes residential customers, businesses, and public entities. Specializing in electricity generation and energy supply, Luminus is particularly recognized for its commitment to renewable energy sources, such as wind and hydropower, positioning itself as the number one provider of onshore wind energy in the country. The company's mission is to contribute to a CO₂-neutral world by providing sustainable electricity and solutions that empower customers to reduce their carbon footprint and optimize their energy consumption. With a strong focus on customer service and transparency, Luminus offers a range of energy contracts—fixed, variable, or dynamic—designed to meet the specific consumption patterns and budget management needs of businesses. The company actively engages with its stakeholders, including customers, partners, and regulatory bodies, to align its operations with the United Nations' Sustainable Development Goals, ensuring compliance with safety standards and ethical practices. Luminus is committed to driving the energy transition through innovative technologies and significant investments in renewable energy projects. The company aims to expand its wind energy capacity to over 1,000 MW by 2027, reflecting its dedication to enhancing energy efficiency and security. Collaborating with various partners, including public institutions and citizen cooperatives, Luminus fosters community involvement in renewable energy initiatives. With over 2,000 employees, Luminus is recognized as an employer of choice, promoting a diverse and inclusive workplace where every individual can thrive. The company also emphasizes corporate social responsibility, integrating sustainable practices into its operations and actively participating in initiatives that promote biodiversity and environmental protection. Overall, Luminus stands out as a key player in Belgium's energy landscape, committed to simplifying energy management for its clients while championing sustainability and innovation.

Company description: KSB Nederland BV is a prominent subsidiary of the KSB Group, specializing in the manufacturing and distribution of high-quality pumps, valves, and related services. Established in 1958, the company has built a strong reputation for delivering innovative solutions that enhance efficiency and sustainability across various sectors, including water management, energy, and industrial applications. KSB Nederland's mission is to inspire customers and partners worldwide to shape a sustainable future through advanced technology and reliable service, encapsulated in its motto "Solutions. For Life." The company serves a diverse clientele, including municipalities, industrial facilities, energy providers, and engineering firms, offering tailored solutions to meet their specific needs. With a focus on innovation, KSB Nederland integrates advanced automation and digitalization technologies into its products, enhancing operational efficiency and sustainability. The company specializes in high-efficiency pumps and valves, particularly for wastewater management and industrial applications, ensuring optimal performance in challenging environments while minimizing lifecycle costs. Operating from two locations in the Netherlands, Zwanenburg and Heinenoord, KSB Nederland boasts a dedicated team of over 70 professionals who provide expert advice, engineering, and service support. KSB Nederland is committed to quality and customer satisfaction, holding certifications under ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001, which reflect its dedication to quality and environmental management. The company emphasizes corporate governance and ethical practices, ensuring compliance with legal standards and fostering a culture of integrity among its employees and stakeholders. By collaborating with partners across multiple sectors, KSB Nederland aims to enhance its product offerings and service capabilities, striving to be a global champion in the fluid handling industry while addressing the evolving needs of its customers.

Name: Dolomiti Energia
Company description: Dolomiti Energia is a leading energy provider focused on delivering sustainable and renewable energy solutions to businesses and households. The company offers a range of services, including fixed-rate energy plans like the Mitica Energia 24 Premium Business, which guarantees stable energy costs for 24 months, allowing clients to concentrate on their growth without worrying about fluctuating energy prices. Committed to environmental sustainability, Dolomiti Energia provides 100% certified renewable electricity and CO2-compensated natural gas, supporting clients in their transition to greener practices. The company also emphasizes customer engagement through free energy checkups and green marketing tools, helping businesses communicate their commitment to sustainability. With a target market that includes small to medium-sized enterprises consuming less than 200,000 kWh annually, Dolomiti Energia aims to empower its clients with transparent billing and efficient energy management solutions.

Company description: Italgas Reti S.p.A. is a prominent company in the natural gas distribution sector, primarily operating in Italy and Greece, and ranks as the third largest operator in Europe. With a rich history of over 185 years, Italgas Reti is dedicated to providing safe, efficient, and sustainable gas distribution services to approximately 12 million customers. The company's mission emphasizes enhancing the quality of life for communities by ensuring reliable energy access while actively contributing to the energy transition and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Italgas Reti focuses on innovation and digital transformation, investing significantly in modernizing its infrastructure, including the integration of renewable gases such as biomethane and hydrogen into its networks. The company operates an extensive distribution network of over 154,000 kilometers, serving a diverse clientele that includes residential, commercial, and industrial users. Italgas Reti collaborates with various stakeholders, including local authorities, regulatory bodies, and energy suppliers, to enhance service delivery and maintain compliance with industry standards. The company's strategic vision aims to solidify its position as a European leader in gas distribution while expanding its capabilities in water services and energy efficiency. With planned investments of €15.6 billion from 2024 to 2030, Italgas Reti is committed to fostering sustainability and promoting a circular economy. The company actively engages in initiatives that support the ecological transition and aims to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. Through its focus on innovation, community engagement, and responsible business practices, Italgas Reti strives to create long-term value for its stakeholders and contribute positively to the environment and society.

Company description: Open Grid Europe GmbH (OGE) is Germany's foremost gas transmission system operator, managing an extensive pipeline network that spans approximately 12,000 kilometers. The company is dedicated to ensuring a secure, efficient, and sustainable energy supply while actively contributing to the energy transition towards low-carbon solutions, particularly through the development of hydrogen infrastructure and CO2 management systems. OGE's mission is to facilitate the shift to renewable energy sources, aligning with Germany's National Hydrogen Strategy and the climate protection targets set by the Paris Agreement.  The company serves a diverse clientele, including industrial partners, energy suppliers, municipalities, and public services, all of whom rely on OGE's robust infrastructure for their energy needs. OGE collaborates closely with various stakeholders in the energy sector, including industry leaders, research institutions, and regulatory bodies like the Federal Network Agency (BNetzA), to create innovative solutions that enhance the energy landscape in Germany and beyond.  With a strong emphasis on safety, environmental sustainability, and operational efficiency, OGE is committed to minimizing emissions and enhancing its infrastructure to support the integration of green gases. The company also prioritizes employee health and safety, fostering a culture of open communication and innovation. Through its initiatives, OGE aims to play a pivotal role in shaping the future of energy in Europe, contributing to climate neutrality goals while ensuring a reliable energy supply for all sectors of society.

Company description: Fluxys is a fully independent gas infrastructure group based in Belgium, specializing in the transportation, storage, and terminal services of natural gas and liquefied natural gas (LNG). The company is dedicated to shaping a sustainable energy future, with a mission to enable a 100% carbon-neutral energy system by 2050. Fluxys actively supports the transition to low-carbon economies by developing innovative infrastructure for hydrogen and carbon dioxide, positioning itself as a key player in the evolving energy landscape. Among its notable assets is the Dunkirk LNG terminal, one of the largest in continental Europe, which underscores its significant role in the LNG market. Fluxys operates a diverse portfolio that includes subsidiaries focused on hydrogen and CO₂ transmission, reflecting its commitment to expanding its services in line with future energy needs. The company serves a wide range of clients, including industrial partners, energy suppliers, and local communities across Europe, the Middle East, and South America. By collaborating with various stakeholders, Fluxys enhances energy security and sustainability, ensuring that it meets the evolving demands of society. Safety, ethical business practices, and transparency are core values at Fluxys, guiding its operations and interactions with stakeholders. The company adheres to international standards and prioritizes responsible operations, fostering strong relationships within its supply chain. Through its Fluxtainable program, Fluxys engages in initiatives that promote environmental conservation and respect for human rights, further solidifying its commitment to sustainability and social responsibility. Overall, Fluxys is poised to play a pivotal role in the transition to a cleaner energy future while maintaining a focus on safety and operational excellence.

Company description: Here at LichtBlick, we create an excellent climate – with green energy for at home and on the move. Climate protection has always been our primary corporate goal. That’s why we have been committed to achieving zero – zero CO₂ –for 25 years. After all, we have to make our lives climate-neutral if we are to save the planet. We are not alone in our commitment: more than 1.7 million customers and our 500 employees are spearheading the energy transition. This makes us Germany’s number one green electricity provider – and number five among all German providers. But that’s not all: alongside 100% green electricity, we are also paving the way to net-zero living with climate-neutral green gas, intelligent solutions for electric vehicles, comprehensive solar power systems and digital efficiency portals for corporate customers. Together, we are avoiding, reducing and offsetting CO₂, promoting climate neutrality and supporting global and regional climate protection projects. This is so important to us that we have incorporated it within our Terms and Conditions as a corporate obligation. Want to join us? If so, follow us here on LinkedIn or find out more about our products, values and career opportunities at lichtblick.de

Company description: ORES is a leading distribution system operator (DSO) based in Wallonia, Belgium, specializing in the management and distribution of electricity and natural gas. Operating in approximately 75% of the region's municipalities, ORES is dedicated to ensuring reliable and efficient energy services, with a mission to "facilitate energy, facilitate life." The company serves a diverse clientele, including residential households, small to medium-sized enterprises, and public authorities, while collaborating closely with local municipalities and intermunicipalities to enhance service delivery and community engagement. With a workforce of around 2,900 employees, ORES emphasizes professionalism and expertise in providing affordable and equitable energy solutions. The company is committed to sustainability and the energy transition, investing significantly in modernizing its infrastructure and integrating renewable energy sources. ORES Assets, a cooperative entity within the company, focuses on the management and operation of energy distribution networks, ensuring safety, reliability, and efficiency in energy supply. In line with its mission, ORES is actively involved in innovative projects, such as the deployment of smart meters and the establishment of renewable energy communities, to promote energy efficiency and environmental responsibility. The company has set an ambitious investment plan of €6 billion over 15 years to strengthen its networks and improve service quality. ORES also prioritizes employee welfare and community involvement, reflecting its commitment to corporate social responsibility. Through strategic partnerships with local governments, energy suppliers, and other stakeholders, ORES aims to navigate the evolving energy landscape while maintaining high standards of service and operational excellence. The company is focused on fostering a greener future, ensuring that all clients have equitable access to energy resources, and contributing positively to the communities it serves.

Company description: Reinhausen Manufacturing - Asset Management is a leading provider of innovative solutions tailored for the energy sector, with a strong emphasis on the optimization and management of transformer assets. The company's mission is to enhance the reliability and efficiency of power supply systems through advanced technologies, including digitalization and automation, while promoting sustainability in energy management. Reinhausen serves a diverse clientele that includes utility companies, industrial manufacturers, and energy providers, particularly those involved in renewable energy projects such as solar and wind farms. By partnering with various stakeholders in the energy sector, Reinhausen delivers tailored solutions that address the unique challenges faced by its clients, ensuring the safe and efficient operation of their electrical infrastructure. The company specializes in the development and production of advanced on-load tap-changers and voltage regulating distribution transformers (VRDTs), which are essential for optimizing transformer performance and maintaining power quality in electrical grids. Reinhausen's commitment to innovation is evident in its cutting-edge products, such as the ECOTAP® VPD® series, designed to meet the growing demands of renewable energy integration and electric mobility infrastructure. With a focus on quality and customer satisfaction, Reinhausen aims to lead the market in asset management solutions, fostering collaboration and continuous improvement. Reinhausen's target market encompasses industries that rely on automated control systems, including energy, manufacturing, and utilities, where the need for effective asset management strategies is paramount. The company is dedicated to supporting the global energy transition by providing solutions that not only enhance the performance and longevity of transformers but also contribute to a more sustainable energy future. Through its comprehensive portfolio and strategic partnerships, Reinhausen Manufacturing - Asset Management is positioned as a key player in the evolving landscape of energy technology, committed to driving innovation and excellence in the sector.

Company description: Eidsiva Energi AS is a prominent Norwegian energy and telecommunications company headquartered in Hamar, specializing in the production, distribution, and sale of renewable energy and broadband services. With over a century of experience, Eidsiva operates through three main business areas: Power Distribution (Elvia), Bioenergy, and Broadband, making it a key player in the transition to a sustainable energy future. The company's mission is to provide innovative and sustainable energy solutions while enhancing connectivity for its diverse clientele, which includes residential, commercial, and public sector customers across southeastern Norway. Eidsiva is committed to driving the green transition, focusing on renewable energy sources such as hydropower, solar, and wind power, while also investing in district heating solutions that utilize local waste resources. The company serves approximately 993,000 customers in power distribution and has a significant stake in Hafslund Kraft AS, Norway's second-largest hydropower producer. Eidsiva's vision emphasizes environmental responsibility, aiming for a 100% renewable energy share in its district heating operations by 2030 and a 60% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030. The company collaborates with various partners, including local municipalities and energy providers, to enhance its service offerings and operational efficiency. Eidsiva also plays a vital role in the telecommunications sector, providing ultrafast broadband services to nearly 98,000 customers and developing fiber optic networks to support smart homes and cities. With a strong focus on sustainability, Eidsiva has established a Green Finance Framework to channel investments into environmentally friendly projects, reinforcing its commitment to responsible growth and community engagement. Eidsiva's dedication to innovation and efficiency positions it as a leader in the energy sector, actively contributing to Norway's climate goals and the electrification of the economy. The company aims to create value for its stakeholders while fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, ensuring that its initiatives align with the interests of the communities it serves.

Company description: Stockholm Exergi is a leading energy provider based in Sweden, specializing in the production and distribution of sustainable district heating, cooling, and electricity services. The company is dedicated to serving the growing urban population of Stockholm, providing reliable energy solutions to over 800,000 residents and numerous businesses, including hospitals and data centers. With a mission to reduce climate impact, Stockholm Exergi operates an extensive district heating network that spans approximately 3,000 kilometers, utilizing resource-efficient solutions derived from renewable sources such as bioenergy and waste.  The company is committed to achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2035 and aims to become Europe's largest permanent negative emitter by 2027 through the implementation of innovative carbon capture technologies. Owned jointly by the City of Stockholm and Ankhiale, Stockholm Exergi emphasizes collaboration with various stakeholders, including local municipalities, businesses, and community organizations, to enhance energy efficiency and promote sustainable practices.  Stockholm Exergi's vision is to support Stockholm's ambition of becoming the world's first climate-positive capital, and it actively engages with local communities to address environmental concerns while ensuring affordable energy solutions. The company prioritizes social responsibility and inclusivity within its corporate culture, fostering a positive impact on society and the environment. Through strategic investments and a focus on innovation, Stockholm Exergi is well-positioned to lead the transition to a low-carbon energy future, reinforcing its role as a key player in the region's energy landscape.

The company is dedicated to providing innovative services in key areas such as cloud computing, software development, data analytics, and system integration, with a particular focus on Microsoft technologies. The firm serves a diverse clientele, including public sector entities, energy providers, and various industries that are seeking to modernize their IT infrastructure. In addition to its core offerings, BTC helps organizations navigate the complexities of hybrid work models and enhances collaboration through Microsoft 365. The company also implements effective change management strategies to ensure smooth transitions for its clients. BTC's vision emphasizes the importance of flexibility and self-organization in the modern workplace, reflecting its commitment to fostering innovation and adaptability among its clients. With strategic partnerships, particularly with industry giants like Microsoft and SAP, BTC aims to deliver cutting-edge solutions that address the evolving needs of its clients in an increasingly digital world. The firm targets small to medium-sized enterprises, as well as larger organizations, ensuring that its services are accessible to a wide range of businesses. Through its expertise and commitment to excellence, BTC strives to facilitate a seamless transition into the digital age, enabling businesses to thrive in an increasingly competitive landscape.

Company description: Enercity is a leading energy provider based in Hannover, Germany, focused on delivering sustainable and innovative heating solutions to residential and commercial clients. The company's mission is to achieve climate neutrality by 2040, actively contributing to the energy transition through the promotion of renewable energy sources, energy efficiency, and the decarbonization of heating systems. Enercity offers a range of services, including the installation of heat pumps, hybrid heating systems, and district heating, catering to a diverse clientele that includes private households, small and medium-sized enterprises, and larger commercial entities. By partnering with various organizations and leveraging data-driven insights, Enercity aims to support its customers in reducing their carbon footprint while enhancing energy efficiency. The company is committed to facilitating the transformation of the building sector in Germany, addressing the significant CO₂ emissions associated with traditional heating methods.

Company description: One Group | One Power ELPEDISON, the 1st independent Energy Producer in Greece and the reliable and friendly Alternative Electricity Supplier, has emerged from the collaboration between two Energy Groups:  - Hellenic Petroleum, one of the largest commercial and industrial energy Groups in Greece and South Eastern Europe,  - Edison, the longest running energy company in Europe and the largest private energy company in Italy, and ELPEDISON, with its two privately owned power plants at Thisvi of Viotia and Thessaloniki and a total installed capacity of 820 MW, uses exclusively natural gas, following a production process which is considerably friendly to the environment.  Furthermore, ELPEDISON covers the electricity needs of all different market segments. It addresses residential customers through its highly competitive Energy Family and Energy Family Plus product ranges. Also, it covers the differentiating needs of business customers, commercial and industrial, connected to the Low Voltage, through its Energy Premium and Energy Premium Plus product portfolios. On top, ELPEDISON caters for the needs of business customers connected to the Medium Voltage, through both standard products and customized propositions.  ELPEDISON provides today a wide spectrum of friendly and facilitating services, via myelpedison web services platform as well as a dedicated Google and Apple mobile application. It also focuses on a high-quality customer service, effectively supporting its customer base. Thanks to the know-how and experience that it has inherited from its mother companies, ELPEDISON aspires to always be a leading company in the Greek Energy production and supply market while providing competitive energy products and services for the consumer’s benefit.

Company description: Stadtwerke Heidelberg GmbH is a municipal utility company dedicated to providing essential services such as electricity, gas, water, and heating to approximately 200,000 residents in Heidelberg and its surrounding areas. With a strong commitment to sustainability and climate protection, the company aims to transition to completely climate-neutral district heating by 2035, with over 50% of its current heating supply already sourced from renewable energy. Through initiatives like heidelberg KLIMAINVEST, Stadtwerke Heidelberg encourages community investment in renewable energy projects, offering attractive returns to participants while promoting local climate action. The company collaborates with local governments and community organizations to enhance the quality of life in the region and support the broader energy transition. Its mission is to provide reliable and sustainable energy solutions while actively engaging the community in environmental stewardship. As a leading energy provider, Stadtwerke Heidelberg focuses on delivering CO2-free district heating, primarily sourced from thermal waste recovery, a biomass power plant, and biomethane combined heat and power plants. Stadtwerke Heidelberg is committed to driving the energy transition locally through its Energy Concept 2030, building on the successes of its previous Energy Concept 2020. The company serves a diverse clientele, including residential, commercial, and industrial customers, and works with various partners to enhance its energy services. Through its initiatives and partnerships, Stadtwerke Heidelberg is dedicated to fostering a sustainable future and ensuring a reliable energy supply for the community, positioning itself as a key player in the region's energy landscape.

Company description: SSE Airtricity is Ireland’s second largest and fastest growing energy provider, supplying over 800,000 domestic and commercial gas, electricity and home energy services customers in the Republic and Northern Ireland.  At SSE Airtricity we believe in making energy better. Around 40% of the electricity SSE Airtricity supplies to its customers on an island basis is generated from renewable sources.  SSE Airtricity is a wholly-owned division of SSE plc, the broadest-based energy utility in the UK and Ireland, with interests and experience in electricity and gas production, distribution, supply and services. The Top 40 FTSE-listed company has over 11,000MW of electricity generation, distributes electricity to 3.5 million homes and businesses and supplies electricity, gas and related services to around 8 million customers.

Company description: Sval Energi is a prominent Norwegian oil and gas company specializing in exploration and production activities primarily in the North Sea, the Middle East, and West Africa. Established with a vision to be a leading, growth-oriented energy provider, Sval Energi is committed to delivering attractive returns to its shareholders while adhering to socially responsible and environmentally sensitive practices. The company's mission emphasizes the importance of minimizing greenhouse gas emissions and enhancing energy efficiency, particularly through the capture and utilization of otherwise-flared associated gas. Sval Energi serves a diverse clientele, including government entities and private sector partners, and targets markets that demand reliable and sustainable energy solutions. The company collaborates with various stakeholders, including local communities, industry leaders, and regulatory bodies, to promote best practices in health, safety, and environmental stewardship. Sval Energi's commitment to human rights and decent working conditions is reflected in its alignment with international standards such as the UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights. Through strategic acquisitions and a robust governance framework, Sval Energi continues to enhance its operational capabilities and expand its portfolio in the competitive energy sector. With a strong emphasis on innovation and technological advancement, Sval Energi aims to optimize production while minimizing its ecological footprint. The company is dedicated to fostering an inclusive workplace that promotes equal opportunities for all employees and prioritizes local hiring to support the economies of the regions in which it operates. Sval Energi's vision encompasses a future where energy production aligns with environmental sustainability and community well-being, positioning the company as a leader in the transition to a low-carbon energy landscape. Through continuous monitoring and assessment of its practices, Sval Energi strives to adapt and improve its strategies in response to evolving environmental and social challenges.

Company description: KEBA Group is an internationally active technology company headquartered in Linz, Austria, with over 50 years of experience in pioneering automation solutions across various industries. The company operates through three main divisions: Industrial Automation, Handover Automation, and Energy Automation, providing innovative control solutions for manufacturers, self-service systems in banking and logistics, and charging infrastructure for electric vehicles. KEBA's mission is to enhance the competitiveness of its clients through cutting-edge technology, focusing on user-friendly designs that improve accessibility and convenience. The company's vision emphasizes innovation and adaptability, aiming to drive the energy transition and digital transformation in industrial processes. With a strong global presence, KEBA has established 28 subsidiaries in 16 countries and employs over 2,100 dedicated professionals committed to delivering sustainable competitive advantages to their customers. The company serves a diverse clientele, including machine and plant manufacturers, major European logistics providers, banks, OEMs, public administrations, and energy providers. KEBA is particularly active in Asia and India, where it addresses the growing demand for automation and energy solutions. Investing 17% of its revenue into research and development, KEBA is dedicated to leveraging artificial intelligence to enhance its products and internal processes. The company collaborates closely with renowned research institutions, universities, and startups to drive open innovation and technological advancements. With a commitment to sustainability and climate-neutral production, KEBA continues to adapt and thrive in a dynamic market environment, ensuring that its solutions remain relevant and effective in a rapidly changing technological landscape.

Company description: Austrian Power Grid AG (APG) is the leading independent transmission system operator in Austria, dedicated to ensuring a secure and reliable electricity supply across the country. With a high-performance digital infrastructure that spans approximately 3,400 kilometers and includes 67 substations, APG plays a pivotal role in the energy transition by integrating renewable energy sources into the national grid. The company's mission is to facilitate the decarbonization of the energy sector while maintaining a remarkable supply security rate of 99.99%. APG is committed to investing around €9 billion in grid expansion and modernization projects by 2034, which are essential for achieving Austria's climate and energy goals. APG collaborates with various stakeholders, including energy producers, distribution network operators, and regulatory authorities, to enhance grid stability and efficiency. Its target market encompasses a diverse clientele, including residential consumers, industrial clients, and energy suppliers, all of whom rely on a stable and sustainable energy supply. The company actively participates in cross-border electricity trading and collaborates with 16 transmission system operators across 13 European countries to optimize capacity management and the integration of renewable resources. Through innovative projects and strategic investments, APG aims to lead the way in modernizing Austria's energy infrastructure and supporting the broader European energy market. The company is also involved in initiatives that promote environmental conservation, such as creating habitats for endangered species along power line routes. By focusing on innovation and sustainability, APG is positioned as a key player in the transition towards a greener energy future, contributing to Austria's commitment to climate neutrality by 2040.

Company description: Alperia Group is a prominent energy provider based in South Tyrol, Italy, specializing in the production and distribution of renewable energy, particularly through hydroelectric power. As the third-largest producer of hydroelectric energy in Italy, Alperia operates 35 hydroelectric plants, 7 photovoltaic systems, and various heating plants, serving over 400,000 customers through an extensive network of 9,348 kilometers. The company's mission is to facilitate the energy transition by promoting clean, renewable energy solutions and fostering responsible consumption practices, with a vision of achieving net-zero emissions by 2040. Alperia is dedicated to sustainability, focusing on minimizing the ecological impact of its operations while enhancing biodiversity and maintaining the ecological balance of watercourses. The company collaborates with local municipalities, businesses, and environmental organizations to implement innovative projects that enhance energy efficiency and sustainability. Alperia's commitment to environmental stewardship is evident in initiatives such as the construction of fish ladders to support aquatic life migration and continuous monitoring of ecological practices. Its diverse clientele includes residential, commercial, and industrial customers, as well as public institutions, all seeking reliable and sustainable energy solutions.  Alperia has received multiple awards for its impactful marketing campaigns, reflecting its dedication to creating authentic connections with the community and raising awareness about ecological issues. The company adheres to international standards such as ISO 14001 and EMAS, demonstrating its commitment to environmental management and continuous improvement. Industries: Civil Engineering, Renewables & Environment, Information Technology And Services, Utilities
Company description: The JUWI Group has been among the leading renewable energy specialists since almost 30 years and offers a full range of project development and other services connected with the planning, construction and operation of renewable energy plants. The company’s business activities especially include wind and solar energy projects as well as hybrid systems with storage facilities for industrial applications. The company is a subsidiary of MVV Energie AG, of Mannheim, one of Germany’s largest municipal energy suppliers. JUWI is headquartered in Wörrstadt near Mainz and has offices in Hanover, Brandis (Saxony), Stuttgart, Bochum, Ansbach, Melle and Rostock. In the summer of 2022, Windwärts Energie GmbH was merged with juwi AG, which was then reconstituted as JUWI GmbH. JUWI was established in 1996 in Rhineland-Palatinate, Windwärts was founded in 1994 in Lower Saxony. Throughout the world, JUWI has a workforce of more than 1,300 people and has projects on all continents. Outside Germany, the company operates subsidiaries in Italy, Greece, South Africa, the USA, Australia, India, the Philippines, Thailand, Vietnam and Singapore. In the wind sector, JUWI has realized more than 1,200 wind turbines with a capacity of more than 3,000 megawatts at about 200 locations throughout the world. In the solar segment, about 1,850 photovoltaic facilities with a total capacity of about 4,000 megawatts have been installed. The JUWI operating team operates wind power and photovoltaic facilities with a total capacity of more than 4,100 megawatts. With a mission to achieve energy independence for Burgenland by 2030, the company focuses on enhancing customer satisfaction and delivering exceptional service, as evidenced by its commitment to maintaining a customer satisfaction rate of over 80%. Burgenland Energie is transforming from a traditional energy supplier into a green technology provider, offering products that enable customers to generate their own electricity and heat, such as solar panels, heat pumps, and energy storage systems. The company serves a diverse clientele, including households, businesses, and municipalities, and collaborates with partners like PÜSPÖK and XXXLutz to develop large-scale renewable energy projects, including one of Europe's largest rooftop photovoltaic installations. Through its strategic initiatives and community engagement, Burgenland Energie aims to contribute significantly to Austria's sustainable energy future.

Company description: Thyssengas GmbH is a prominent transmission system operator headquartered in Dortmund, Germany, with a specialization in the transportation of natural gas and the development of hydrogen infrastructure. With over a century of experience, the company is dedicated to facilitating the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy sources, particularly focusing on hydrogen and biogas, to support Germany's climate neutrality objectives. Thyssengas operates an extensive network of approximately 4,400 kilometers of pipelines, catering to a diverse clientele that includes industrial partners, municipalities, and energy suppliers primarily in North Rhine-Westphalia and parts of Lower Saxony. The company's mission is to enable sustainable energy supplies while ensuring reliability and affordability for its customers. Thyssengas is actively engaged in establishing a robust hydrogen transport infrastructure, positioning itself as a key player in the future of energy in Europe. The company is committed to transparency and continuous improvement in sustainability practices, aligning with the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and striving to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. Through strategic partnerships and initiatives, Thyssengas aims to significantly contribute to the hydrogen economy and support the decarbonization of industrial processes in the regions it serves. The company is also focused on connecting major hydrogen consumption and production areas through its pipeline network, playing a pivotal role in the realization of the H2Kernnetz, a nationwide hydrogen infrastructure project set for completion by 2032. Prioritizing safety, environmental protection, and customer satisfaction, Thyssengas ensures that the needs and expectations of its clients are met through reliable services and innovative solutions.

Company description: Ishavskraft er en av Norges største strømleverandører og leverer strøm til både privat- og bedriftskunder over hele landet. Vi ble etablert i 1997 og er et heleid datterselskap av Troms Kraft AS. Med over 90 ansatte fordelt på kontorer i Alta, Tromsø, Oslo, Bergen og Kristiansand, er vi en solid aktør i markedet som bidrar til lønnsom og bærekraftig vekst med positive ringvirkninger i lokalsamfunnene. Ishavskraft er genuint opptatt av å skape de beste kundeopplevelsene. Vår driv, i kombinasjon med ærlighet og varme, verdsettes høyt av kundene våre og bekreftes av kundetilfredsheten: 92 % av de som er i kontakt med kundeservice gir oss toppkarakter. Hele Ishavskraft samarbeider hver dag for å gjøre strøm enklere og mer forståelig. Gjennom tydelig kommunikasjon og digitale løsninger som Ishavskraft-appen, Min side og Online bedrift får kundene full oversikt over strømforbruk, avtaler og kostnader. Med bærekraft i fokus jobber vi i Ishavskraft for en mer åpen og ansvarlig bransje. Selskapet er ISO-sertifisert etter følgende standarder: ISO 9001:2015 – Kvalitet ISO 14001:2015 – Miljø ISO 45001:2018 – Arbeidsmiljø

Company description: Herzlich willkommen bei den Stadtwerken Düren! Die Stadtwerke Düren GmbH ist der Energie- und Wasserversorger für die Stadt Düren sowie die Gemeinde Merzenich. Anteilseigner der SWD sind die Stadt Düren und die Innogy SE. Die Stadtwerke Düren GmbH bietet ihren rund 60.000 Kunden Strom, Gas, Wasser und damit verbundene Dienstleistungen aus einer Hand. Die SWD-Gruppe beschäftigt zusammen mit ihrem Tochterunternehmen, der Leitungspartner GmbH, rund 260 Mitarbeiter, davon im Durchschnitt 18 Auszubildende. In puncto Umwelt sind die SWD regional und überregional stark engagiert. Dazu gehört die Beteiligung an der Green GECCO GmbH & Co. KG und an der Rurenergie GmbH. Beide Gemeinschaftsunternehmen entwickeln und realisieren Projekte rund um regenerative Energien. Das Umweltmanagementsystem der SWD entspricht der international geltenden Umweltnorm DIN EN ISO 14001, zertifiziert durch den TÜV Nord. Das Unternehmen ist zudem TSM zertifiziert. Seit 2008 wurden die SWD bis einschließlich 2019 jährlich vom Energieverbraucherportal als TOP-Lokalversorger ausgezeichnet und seit 2015 auch als TOP-Lokalversorger Wasser. 2016 wurden die SWD von FOCUS-MONEY als TOP-Stromanbieter ausgezeichnet. Die TOP-Performer Auszeichnung haben die SWD erstmals 2018 erhalten. 2019 erfolgte u.a. von FOCUS-MONEY die Auszeichnung „Bester Stromversorger“ für die Region Düren.  Und wie sieht es mit dem Betriebsklima aus? 71% aller Mitarbeiter/innen der SWD-Gruppe würden die Stadtwerke Düren Freunden als Arbeitgeber empfehlen (Mitarbeiterbefragung 2018) Interessiert? Mehr Infos unter: https://www.stadtwerke-dueren.de/corporate/karriere/  Natürlich finden Sie uns auch auf Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/stadtwerke.dueren Wir freuen uns auf Ihren Besuch auch dort!

Company description: Union Energia è la prima sharing company dell'energia in Italia. Union energia si differenzia da tutti gli altri player perché ha scelto di condividere gli utili con i propri partner. Quindi la prima fondamentale differenza è che noi non abbiamo clienti, abbiamo partner, con i quali condividiamo i nostri utili, e offriamo a chiunque la possibilità di ridurre sensibilmente o addirittura azzerare le bollette energetiche e il Canone RAI. Sono già migliaia i nostri “clienti” che ricevono fatture con 0 € come importo da pagare, grazie all’Union Sharing Bonus, e saranno sempre di più perché non esiste un solo motivo valido per non entrare a far parte di Union Energia. Name: FGSZ Földgázszállító Zrt.
Technologies: .NET, Drupal, ITIL, Visual Studio, SAP Basis, Sencha, Operative, SAP, Ext JS, ASSET, Disaster Recovery, TOPdesk, Microsoft Office SharePoint, Capex, Opex, Sencha Ext JS, SQL, Azure, Daily, SQL Server, MS SQL, Payroll, PHP, Chitika, Ubuntu, Microsoft ASP.NET, Polyfill, Bootstrap, HSTS, Nginx, Google Maps, X-XSS-Protection, jsDelivr, Microsoft SharePoint, Open Graph, X-Content-Type-Options, jQuery, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Apple iCloud Mail, reCAPTCHA
Company description: FGSZ is the owner and operator of the Hungarian high-pressure natural gas pipeline system servicing gas distribution companies, power plants and large industrial consumers. The technical standard of the Hungarian transmission system is among the best in the world based on international comparison. We provide our services with a team of professionals, focusing on the satisfaction of our partners. FGSZ has a key role in ensuring the safety of the natural gas supply of Hungary and the entire Central and Eastern Europe Region. Our services have been synonymous with quality and continuous improvement for decades and this is also what we offer to our employees: a long-term career at a reliable company with a long history and a secure future.  Az FGSZ Zrt. a tulajdonosa és üzemeltetője a Magyarország területét behálózó nagynyomású földgázszállító vezetékrendszernek, amely a gázszolgáltató társaságokat, erőműveket és a nagyipari fogyasztókat látja el. A magyarországi szállítórendszer műszaki színvonala – nemzetközi összehasonlítások alapján – a világ élvonalába tartozik. Szolgáltatásainkat professzionális csapattal, partnereink elégedettségére fókuszálva biztosítjuk. Az FGSZ kulcsszerepet tölt be Magyarország és az egész közép-európai régió földgázellátás biztonságában. Company description: Energieversorgung Oberhausen AG (evo) is a local energy provider committed to ecological, social, and economic responsibility in Oberhausen. The company emphasizes sustainability as a holistic concept, integrating efficient energy generation, biomass utilization, and the use of industrial waste heat in its operations. Evo is also preparing its gas power plants for future hydrogen use, reflecting its role as a pioneer in the local energy and climate transition. Beyond energy supply, evo actively contributes to enhancing the quality of life in Oberhausen by investing in cultural and recreational initiatives and supporting community events. The company prioritizes the secure energy supply for its customers while maintaining a long-term and responsible approach in the energy markets. Through its sustainability report, evo transparently shares its projects and goals, reinforcing its commitment to a greener future for the community.

Company description: Eurowind Energy A/S is a prominent renewable energy company based in Denmark, dedicated to the development, construction, and operation of wind and solar energy projects across Europe and North America. Established in 2006, the company has positioned itself as a key player in the renewable energy sector, with a mission to contribute to a sustainable future by providing clean energy solutions that significantly reduce carbon emissions. Eurowind Energy operates a diverse portfolio that includes wind, solar, hydrogen, biogas, and battery storage solutions, reflecting its commitment to innovative technologies and sustainable practices. With a robust project pipeline of approximately 54 GW and over 2 GW under asset management, Eurowind Energy serves a wide range of clients, including local governments, energy suppliers, industrial partners, and private investors. The company prioritizes collaboration with various stakeholders, including local communities and conservation experts, to ensure that its projects align with environmental and social needs. Eurowind Energy's commitment to sustainability is evident in its operational practices, which emphasize biodiversity and responsible resource management. The company aims to become a Power Major by 2030, focusing on expanding its capacity in onshore wind and solar energy while integrating innovative solutions such as Power-to-X (PtX) for sustainable fuel production. In the 2023/24 fiscal year, Eurowind Energy produced 1,883 GWh of green electricity, helping to avoid 457,671 tonnes of CO2 emissions, showcasing its impact on the environment. With operations in 16 countries, including Denmark, Poland, Germany, and the United States, Eurowind Energy is well-positioned for continued growth and innovation in the renewable energy landscape. Through its strategic initiatives and partnerships, Eurowind Energy envisions a future where renewable energy is accessible and affordable for all, contributing to energy security and sustainability for communities and industries alike. The company is committed to achieving carbon neutrality by 2030, reinforcing its role as a leader in the transition to a greener economy.

Company description: Syneco was founded in 1999 as the energy service provider of the Thüga Group. Today, Syneco is one of the most important energy trading companies in Germany. Under the umbrella brand Thüga Solutions, we cover, in cooperation with the other Thüga Plus companies, the increasingly complex energy industry almost completely. We support municipal and medium-sized energy suppliers in energy procurement and marketing. We deal with efficient and sustainable ways of energy trading to support our partners with innovative software solutions, services and broad know-how and provide a significant contribution to the energy transition. Our software solutions offer the possibility to digitalize and automate processes of energy procurement and marketing. Our broad product portfolio enables the cost-efficient and transparent handling of trading in electricity, gas and CO2, as well as the associated energy logistics processes and risk management. Renewable energy products are also part of our portfolio. Together with our partners, we are constantly developing our products for automating procurement and marketing, thus adapting to market changes at an early stage. A trusting exchange with our partners is our top priority.  We are always on the lookout for creative minds who want to be part of the energy world. Our employees are involved in exciting fields of activity, benefit from flexible working time models and many other benefits. We provide all information on our job postings on our homepage: https://www.syneco.net/karriere/

Company description: Elawan Energy S.L., formerly known as Gestamp Wind, is a global leader in the renewable energy sector, specializing in the development, construction, and management of wind farms, solar plants, and hydroelectric power stations. As a subsidiary of the ORIX Group, Elawan is dedicated to driving the energy transition through innovative and sustainable solutions, with a mission to contribute to global sustainability and environmental goals. The company has established a diverse portfolio, boasting over 10 GW of projects promoted and more than 2.1 GW operational worldwide. Elawan serves a wide range of clients, including major corporations like Google and Cellnex, as well as governments and energy providers, delivering high-quality energy solutions tailored to their specific needs. Elawan's vision emphasizes respect for diversity and excellence in management, fostering a culture of efficiency and collaboration. The company is committed to ethical governance and positive community impact, ensuring that people are at the center of its strategy. With a strong focus on adaptability and innovation, Elawan Energy aims to expand its footprint in the renewable energy market, particularly in regions with high potential for wind energy generation. Through strategic partnerships and a commitment to reducing carbon emissions, Elawan is poised to play a significant role in the global energy transition, contributing to a cleaner and more sustainable future for all.

Company description: Bosch Industrial specializes in the development and manufacturing of advanced electric heating solutions, particularly through its innovative ELHB electric boiler system, which generates hot water and heating energy with outputs of up to 5.5 MW. The company's mission is to provide sustainable and efficient heating solutions that significantly reduce CO₂ emissions by utilizing renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and hydroelectric power. Bosch Industrial serves a diverse clientele, including commercial and industrial sectors that require reliable heating and process heat solutions, and partners with various energy providers to enhance system integration and efficiency. With a commitment to quality and safety, all products are manufactured in Germany, adhering to stringent standards and regulations. The company aims to lead the transition towards climate-friendly heating technologies, offering tailored solutions and expert services to meet the unique needs of its customers.

Company description: OMICRON Electronics, headquartered in Klaus, is a leading provider of testing technology for energy infrastructures, specializing in the development of innovative testing devices for electrical protection systems. With a mission to enhance safety and efficiency in the energy sector, OMICRON has recently launched the CMC 500, a state-of-the-art device designed to meet the growing demands for cybersecurity and personnel safety in electrical testing. The company has experienced significant growth, achieving a revenue increase of over six percent in 2024, driven by rising investments in energy network modernization and the energy transition. OMICRON serves a diverse clientele, including energy providers, service companies in the energy sector, and industrial enterprises, and is committed to expanding its global presence with a workforce of 1,300 employees across 23 locations. The company is focused on continuous innovation and infrastructure development to support its long-term growth and the evolving needs of its customers.

Company description: We, Eraneos Strategy (formerly SMP Strategy Consulting), are the strategy consulting arm of the Eraneos Group - we combine strategic excellence with genuine commitment. Our team develops sustainable strategies and outstanding customer experiences with a focus on financial services providers, energy suppliers, and telecommunications companies. Thanks to our strong customer focus, excellent performance, and exceptional boutique culture, we have achieved double-digit growth rates for years. In addition to the Eraneos Strategy headquarters in Düsseldorf, we have Eraneos locations in Hamburg, Munich, and eleven other countries. As part of the Eraneos Group, we are jointly setting the course for further growth: our service portfolio has expanded to include capabilities such as customer & commercial excellence, organizational & transformation excellence, data & AI, sourcing & IT advisory, and cybersecurity. We work closely with our experts to develop tailor-made consulting services for our clients – from strategy to successful implementation, end-to-end. Together with Eraneos, we are tapping into new industries and expanding our international environment. Our ambition: as a European challenger, to redefine the successful transformation of our clients while maintaining our proven boutique culture! Company description: Haugaland Kraft is a leading energy and telecommunications company based in Haugesund, Norway, specializing in the production, transmission, and sale of electrical power, as well as the development and operation of fiber networks. Established in 1909 through the merger of local energy companies, Haugaland Kraft has evolved into a key player in the Haugalandet, Sunnhordland, inner Ryfylke, and parts of Hardanger regions. The company's mission is to empower strong and sustainable local communities by providing innovative and reliable energy solutions, including hydropower, solar energy, and fiber services. Haugaland Kraft is committed to facilitating the green transition and ensuring a stable supply of electricity and connectivity for its diverse clientele, which includes residential customers, businesses, and municipalities. The company actively engages in sustainability initiatives, aligning its operations with the UN's 17 Sustainable Development Goals, and has made significant investments in renewable energy projects, including offshore wind through its partnership with Deep Wind Offshore. Haugaland Kraft prioritizes health, safety, and environmental considerations in all its operations, aiming to minimize its ecological footprint while contributing positively to the local community's development. With a workforce of approximately 500 employees, the company fosters a safe and inclusive corporate culture, emphasizing continuous improvement and innovation in its services. Haugaland Kraft collaborates with various stakeholders, including local governments and other energy providers, to enhance its service offerings and promote economic growth in the region. The company's vision reflects its commitment to community engagement and responsible business practices, ensuring that it remains a trusted partner in the areas it serves. By investing in technology and customer-centric solutions, such as the "Mitt hjem" app for energy management, Haugaland Kraft aims to simplify and secure the daily lives of its customers while driving the transition to a sustainable energy future.

Company description: EWR AG is a forward-thinking company dedicated to sustainability and climate protection, positioning itself as a key player in the development of future-proof energy systems. With a mission to create value for the region and its people, EWR AG emphasizes its commitment to economic, ecological, and social responsibilities, which are deeply embedded in its corporate strategy. The company aims to achieve net-zero emissions by 2045, aligning with the German government's climate goals and the UN's scientifically validated 1.5-degree target. EWR AG collaborates with local municipalities, energy providers, and environmental organizations to implement ambitious climate protection initiatives and enhance biodiversity in the region. Its target market includes local communities and businesses that prioritize sustainable energy solutions and responsible resource management. Through transparency and accountability, EWR AG strives to foster long-term partnerships and contribute positively to the environment and society.

Company description: Insta Digital is a diversified technology company based in Tampere, Finland, dedicated to empowering a secure and sustainable future through innovative solutions across various sectors, including industry, defense, software development, and cyber security. With over 60 years of experience, the company has established itself as a frontrunner in the technology landscape, recognized for its commitment to enhancing security, performance, and sustainability in an increasingly digital world. Insta Digital's mission is to support a wide range of clients—from corporations to public sector organizations—by providing comprehensive services that encompass cyberattack prevention, automation, and secure communication solutions. The company operates across four key business areas: industry, defense, cyber security, and software consulting, serving a diverse clientele that includes government agencies, industrial manufacturers, and energy providers. Insta Digital has forged strong partnerships with leading companies such as Valmet and Lockheed Martin, which enhance its technological capabilities and market reach. Its commitment to environmental responsibility is evident in significant projects, such as the instrumentation installations for the Naistenlahti 3 biomass-fired boiler plant, and initiatives aimed at recovering waste heat from data centers in collaboration with Microsoft and Fortum. Insta Digital's vision emphasizes collaboration and expertise in technology, automation, and cybersecurity, ensuring that it remains a trusted partner in critical infrastructure and defense sectors. The company has achieved 14 consecutive years of revenue growth, reflecting its dedication to continuous improvement and customer satisfaction. With a strong international network spanning over 50 countries, Insta Digital is well-positioned to meet the evolving needs of its clients and the global market while fostering a culture of responsibility and sustainability. Through its innovative solutions, Insta Digital aims to drive the green transition and create a more efficient future for all.

Company description: Bayernets GmbH is a leading gas transmission company dedicated to ensuring a reliable and sustainable gas supply for Germany's economy. With a strong focus on developing hydrogen infrastructure, Bayernets is actively involved in creating a comprehensive hydrogen network in Bavaria, collaborating with regional distribution network operators to enhance the region's energy transition. The company's mission is to support the decarbonization of the energy sector by leveraging existing gas infrastructure while planning for future hydrogen needs. Bayernets serves a diverse clientele, including industrial consumers and energy suppliers, and partners with various stakeholders to synchronize strategies for hydrogen utilization. Through innovative projects and a commitment to sustainability, Bayernets aims to play a pivotal role in shaping a decarbonized energy landscape in Bavaria and beyond.

Company description: Der Energieanbieter Rabot Energy macht es für jeden möglich, unkompliziert aktiver Teil der Energiewende zu werden.  Rabot Energy denkt Energie neu und bietet für Kund*innen einen dynamischen Stromtarif für Haushalt und Elektroauto mit 100% Ökostrom an. Das heißt, im Gegensatz zu anderen Stromanbietern, kauft Rabot Energy Strom kurzfristig über den Day-Ahead und Intraday-Markt ein, nutzt somit die stündlichen Preisschwankungen an der Strombörse und gibt den Einkaufspreis direkt an Kund*innen weiter. So können zum Beispiel E-Autos automatisiert dann geladen werden, wenn der Börsenstrompreis in einem festgelegten Ladezeitfenster besonders gering ist. Da bei viel Wind und Sonne die Preise niedrig sind, wird so nicht nur der Geldbeutel geschont, sondern auch die Umwelt.  Den Energieverbrauch sowie das smarte und automatisierte Energiemanagement können Verbraucher*innen in Echtzeit in der Rabot Energy App nachverfolgen und steuern. Ziel ist es, intelligenten und nachhaltigen Stromkonsum für jeden zugänglich zu machen und den Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien voranzutreiben, um den Klimawandel zu bekämpfen.

Company description: Berliner Stadtwerke GmbH is a municipal energy provider dedicated to supplying 100% green electricity to households and public institutions in Berlin. The company aims to increase the share of ecologically produced energy in the city while actively contributing to the reduction of CO2 emissions, aligning with its mission to make Berlin climate-neutral. Berliner Stadtwerke serves a diverse clientele, including approximately 6,500 properties such as schools, government offices, and public lighting systems, ensuring that over 200,000 streetlights operate on environmentally friendly power. Additionally, the company is expanding its public charging infrastructure for electric vehicles, with plans to double the number of charging points by 2030. Through partnerships with local residents and organizations, Berliner Stadtwerke is committed to fostering a sustainable future for the city and its inhabitants.

Company description: PZEM Energy Company B.V., a subsidiary of EP NL and part of the EPH Group, is a leading energy provider in the Netherlands, specializing in electricity generation, trading, and supply solutions for businesses. Established in 1919, PZEM has evolved to play a crucial role in the energy sector, focusing on delivering reliable and sustainable energy solutions while supporting the transition to a net-zero future. The company's mission emphasizes operational excellence and financial stability, with a vision centered on sustainability and efficiency in energy consumption. PZEM serves a diverse clientele, including industrial customers, municipalities, and residential consumers, and is committed to providing tailored energy solutions that meet the evolving needs of its market. The company operates a diverse portfolio of gas-fired power plants and engages in wholesale energy trading across Europe, particularly in key markets such as the Netherlands, Germany, and the United Kingdom. PZEM's strategic partnerships, including a notable contract with Urenco Nederland B.V. for the supply of CO2-free electricity, highlight its dedication to innovative energy solutions and collaboration with industry leaders. As it prepares for a rebranding to EP Commodities B.V. in February 2025, PZEM aims to enhance its visibility and strengthen its market position in the business energy sector. With a strong focus on innovation, PZEM utilizes advanced plant optimization software to forecast market prices and manage volatility, ensuring efficient operations and strategic decision-making. The company is also involved in hedging and risk management, enabling its clients to navigate the complexities of the energy market effectively. PZEM's commitment to sustainability and efficiency positions it as a dynamic player in the energy landscape, actively participating in shaping the future of energy through its comprehensive service offerings and collaborative efforts with various stakeholders.

Company description: Soly is a leading provider of sustainable energy solutions, specializing in solar panels, home batteries, charging stations, and energy management systems. The company's mission is to make solar energy accessible to everyone, striving for a 100% sustainable future for both individuals and businesses. Soly serves a diverse clientele, ranging from households to corporate clients, offering customized solutions that include attractive discounts through partnerships with organizations like Corporate Benefits. The company takes pride in its innovative products, such as bifacial glass-glass solar panels and advanced home batteries, which are not only efficient but also contribute to the energy transition. By utilizing dynamic energy contracts and smart technologies like the Soly Brain, Soly helps customers optimize their energy consumption and save on costs. In addition to residential solutions, Soly is also a prominent player in the commercial sector, providing flexible options for leasing and purchasing solar panel systems tailored to the financial needs of businesses. Their target market includes small to large enterprises looking to reduce energy expenses and improve their environmental impact. Soly collaborates with various partners, including energy suppliers and local governments, to facilitate the installation of solar systems and innovative solutions like ZonneCarports, which maximize space utilization for energy generation. With a strong focus on sustainability and customer satisfaction, Soly positions itself as a reliable partner in the energy transition, offering tailored advice and support to ensure businesses can effectively transition to renewable energy.

Company description: AKG Group is a leading global provider of high-quality radiators and heat exchangers, renowned for its customer-oriented solutions in thermal management. With over 100 years of experience, the company operates 11 business units across various countries, including Germany, France, the USA, and China, employing around 3,200 professionals who produce over 2.5 million heat exchangers annually. AKG's mission is to deliver innovative and reliable thermal management solutions for diverse applications, including construction equipment, industrial coolers, and renewable energy systems. The company is committed to sustainability, exemplified by its recent partnership with Consolar to produce advanced PVT heat pump collectors, contributing to a greener future. AKG serves a wide range of clients, from industrial manufacturers to renewable energy providers, and aims to meet the growing demands of the global market with tailored solutions and cutting-edge technology.

Company description: Nederland is verdeeld in vijfentwintig veiligheidsregio’s, waar Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden (de VRH) er één van is. Om de veiligheid in de regio te vergroten en voorbereid te zijn op (grootschalige) incidenten, bundelen hulpdiensten en gemeenten hun krachten. De Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden bestaat uit: - Brandweer Haaglanden (en meldkamer); - GHOR: Geneeskundige Hulpverleningsorganisatie in de Regio; De Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden werkt intensief samen met andere organisaties, zoals de gemeenten in de regio, Politie eenheid Den Haag, ministeries, provincie Zuid-Holland, defensie, energieleveranciers, ziekenhuizen en waterschappen. Om samen op te kunnen treden als het nodig is én om voorbereidingen te treffen om calamiteiten te voorkomen. Altijd paraat! De Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden werkt 24 uur per dag, 7 dagen in de week aan de veiligheid in de Regio Haaglanden. Zij doet dit voor alle regiogemeenten: Delft, Den Haag, Leidschendam-Voorburg, Midden-Delfland, Pijnacker-Nootdorp, Rijswijk, Wassenaar, Westland en Zoetermeer. De burgemeesters van deze gemeenten vormen samen het bestuur van de Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden. De taken van de Veiligheidsregio Haaglanden staan omschreven in de Wet op de Veiligheidsregio's.

Company description: Norske Skog is a leading global producer of publication and packaging paper, with a specialization in newsprint, magazine paper, and recycled containerboard. With over 60 years of experience, the company operates four mills in Europe and one in Australia, boasting an impressive annual production capacity of 1.3 million tonnes of publication paper and 0.8 million tonnes of packaging paper. Norske Skog is dedicated to sustainability and innovation, with a mission to minimize its environmental footprint through responsible business practices and continuous improvement, aiming for net-zero emissions by 2050. The company serves a diverse clientele, including publishers, packaging manufacturers, and various industries that require high-quality paper products.  Norske Skog is committed to enhancing its operational efficiency and maintaining a competitive edge in the market by optimizing production costs and adapting to changing market demands. As part of its strategic initiatives, the company is transitioning towards packaging solutions to meet the growing demand for eco-friendly products while upholding high standards of quality and reliability under its NOR and STRATO brands. The company actively engages in initiatives to promote biodiversity and responsible sourcing of certified wood, adhering to internationally recognized environmental management systems.  Norske Skog collaborates with various partners, including suppliers of raw materials and energy providers, to ensure compliance with environmental standards and certifications. With a workforce of around 1,700 employees, the company is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, and is publicly traded on the Oslo Stock Exchange under the ticker NSKOG. Through its strategic focus on sustainability and innovation, Norske Skog positions itself as a key player in the global paper market, contributing positively to the circular economy while meeting the evolving needs of its clients.

Company description: Items GmbH & Co. KG is a specialized service provider in the energy sector, with a strong focus on the Meter-to-Cash process chain for energy supply companies (EVUs). With over 25 years of experience, the company delivers comprehensive solutions encompassing market communication, billing, payment and receivables management, customer service, and quality assurance. This ensures that energy providers can efficiently meet regulatory requirements while enhancing their operational efficiency through standardized and automated processes tailored to individual needs. Items GmbH serves a diverse clientele, including critical infrastructure operators and essential service providers across sectors such as energy, water supply, and healthcare.  The company is dedicated to strengthening the cybersecurity and operational resilience of its partners in an increasingly regulated environment, offering both temporary support and full outsourcing options. Items GmbH is also a leading IT service provider, specializing in the needs of municipal energy and water management as well as public transportation. With a team of over 370 committed employees, the company develops innovative solutions for digital transformation aimed at improving the quality of life in cities and regions.  Items GmbH's mission is to create sustainable and efficient energy supply systems through digitalization, networking, and automation, addressing the challenges posed by climate change. The company fosters close relationships with its clients and partners to provide tailored solutions that meet the specific demands of the industry. Items GmbH promotes a corporate culture of openness, teamwork, and personal development, enhancing employee satisfaction and innovation. The firm also specializes in consulting, empowering energy providers, particularly municipal utilities, by translating regulatory and market developments into practical, sustainable strategies. Led by experienced professionals, Items GmbH aims to be at the forefront of energy transformation, offering valuable resources and guidance to help clients navigate the complexities of the energy market.

Company description: NeN è un fornitore di energia innovativo che offre gas e luce 100% green attraverso un modello di abbonamento completamente digitale. La missione di NeN è semplificare la gestione delle forniture energetiche, eliminando la burocrazia e rendendo le bollette chiare e comprensibili per tutti. Con una sola offerta che prevede una rata fissa mensile, i clienti possono bloccare il prezzo della materia prima per un anno, garantendo stabilità e trasparenza nei costi. NeN si rivolge a un ampio pubblico, inclusi clienti domestici e piccole imprese in tutta Italia, e collabora con iniziative come "Nipote in affitto" per supportare le persone anziane nell'apprendimento delle tecnologie digitali. La visione di NeN è quella di rendere l'energia accessibile e sostenibile per tutti, promuovendo un consumo responsabile e consapevole. NeN si distingue per la sua offerta di gas e luce a impatto zero, grazie a un impegno attivo nella compensazione delle emissioni di CO₂ attraverso progetti di carbon offset in Ruanda e Ucraina. La compagnia garantisce ai clienti di pagare solo per l'energia effettivamente consumata, senza costi aggiuntivi. La clientela di NeN comprende sia utenti domestici che aziende, con un focus particolare su coloro che cercano soluzioni energetiche ecologiche e convenienti. NeN collabora con partner come LifeGate per monitorare e compensare la propria impronta di carbonio, rivolgendo la sua offerta a un mercato sempre più attento alla sostenibilità e all'efficienza energetica. Con un mix energetico 100% green, NeN si propone di rendere l'energia accessibile e responsabile per tutti. L'azienda ha sviluppato un programma di fidelizzazione chiamato Radici, che premia i clienti con sconti e vantaggi in base alla loro anzianità. Con un forte impegno verso la sostenibilità, NeN si distingue per il suo approccio innovativo e digitale nella gestione delle forniture, supportato da un'app intuitiva e una serie di servizi aggiuntivi. NeN si impegna a garantire trasparenza e supporto ai propri clienti, offrendo anche promozioni e sconti per incentivare l'adozione delle proprie forniture, adattandosi così alle esigenze del mercato e contribuendo a un futuro più sostenibile per tutti.
